etymologies: from Latin strigilis, from stringere ‘touch lightly’. The term in entomology dates from the late 19th century

definitions: an instrument with a curved blade used, especially by ancient Greeks and Romans, to scrape sweat and dirt from the skin in a hot-air bath or after exercise; a scraper.
shortDefinitions: instrument used to scrape sweat and dirt from skin

definitions: a comblike structure on the forelegs of some insects, used chiefly for grooming.
shortDefinitions: comblike structure on forelegs of some insects
